channel.title: Digital Humanities Questions & Answers » Topic: What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?

textInput.title: Search

textInput.name: q

item.title: Bethany Nowviskie on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Bethany Nowviskie
item.description: 55. Can someone help me learn to scan a document and use OCR software?

item.title: Dorothea Salo on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Dorothea Salo
item.description: (I'm starting to think we need to write a "How Not To Do It" manual, along the lines of Web Pages That Suck and this response to the NSF's request for data-management plans. Who's in?)

item.title: Eric Johnson on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Eric Johnson
item.description:
Some fundamental ones I've heard (or asked):

53. What can I do in here? What do you all do? What happens here?
53A. Am I allowed to X [surf/use edit suite/write paper/start a side business/mount a revolution] in here?
54. Do you have equipment/service X?

item.title: Bethany Nowviskie on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Bethany Nowviskie
item.description: 52. Could you please send somebody to teach a unit on [X] to my class? Preferably on Thursday of this week. Or shall I just bring them by?

item.title: MelissaTerras on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: MelissaTerras
item.description:
50. Can I get a one-to-one tutorial from you about a subject you teach. It will only take an hour. No, I cant just download your teaching materials from the website or come to a lecture you are giving on the subject.

more positively:
51. I have a little pot of cash for someone to help sort out our website/database/project domain. Do you have any good grad students we could employ for a couple of days just to sort it out? We will pay good rates, we just dont have the time to do it ourselves.

item.title: MelissaTerras on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: MelissaTerras
item.description: 49. I'm writing a grant on my [pure humanities subject] and I need to incorporate the internet somehow. Can you write the technical parts?

item.title: Bethany Nowviskie on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Bethany Nowviskie
item.description:
Oh, here are three more!

46. I'm not affiliated in any way with [your university]. To what degree can you provide me with equipment, software, data services, consultation, and staff time to develop my project?

47. I think I found an error in an electronic text your group published many years ago. Please research and fix? (It's worth noting that often these are genuine textual variants in a diplomatic transcription.)

48. I'd like to reproduce a passage from [quite often, a public domain e-text] in your collection. May I?

item.title: Bethany Nowviskie on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Bethany Nowviskie
item.description:
43. I heard a member of your staff [is experimenting with / mentioned in public / once met somebody who knows about] [Tool or Platform or Method X]. This means you provide training, hosting and development on [X] as a dependable service to the university community, correct?

44. I have demographic or other tabular data and want to create an interactive map.

45. I'm publishing a book or article and need to include a professional-looking, custom map of [Area X] showing [Features A, B, and C]. This is for print.

item.title: Karin Dalziel on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Karin Dalziel
item.description:
36. Specific programming questions - how can I do X with Y language? - This question usually comes from grad students or early career scholars who have jumped into learning how to code but get stuck.
37. Encoding questions - what programs to use, where to start, how to handle special characters, etc.
38. Where's the bathroom/ref desk/dean's office? <- most common
39. What makes a design "good?" (This question is usually a lead in for general design help/consultation)
40. I have a bunch of images, how can I resize them?
41. I'm going to an archive and need to take pictures of documents, do you have any advice on how to get good pictures? What camera do I need?
42. I went to an archive and took pictures of documents and they look horrible, how can I fix them?

item.title: Dorothea Salo on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Dorothea Salo
item.description:
34. Back in the day, a really bright graduate student made this [thing], and now that she's gone nobody else knows how to use or maintain it. What do we do now?
35. I want to do a digital project, with your collaboration on [thing]. I have a really bright graduate student to build it for me, so it'll all go fine.

(Juxtaposition entirely intentional.)

item.title: Patrick Murray-John on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Patrick Murray-John
item.description:
32. I can't email this PDF to a colleague. Does it matter that it's 150MB? (that is, lots of file size optimization questions for all kinds of files)
33. What video format should I be using?

item.title: Bethany Nowviskie on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Bethany Nowviskie
item.description:
29. I can't seem to install [Software X].
30. I've installed [Software X] because I heard it was good for [Research Issue Y]. Now what?

31. My students will be contributing content to [my project], and I will want to put their work online. Are there copyright or intellectual property issues I should think of ahead of time? (Just kidding: this actually goes: "My students have been contributing to [my project] for a decade. I don't even remember their names anymore. This is all cool to publish, right?")

item.title: Dorothea Salo on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Dorothea Salo
item.description: 28. I have tons and tons of research stuff. It's all disorganized. I want to put it all on the Web. And I want to dump it all (analog and digital) on somebody else because I don't have space for it. Please help.

item.title: Miriam Posner on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Miriam Posner
item.description: Oh, these are terrific! Thank you! I'd love to hear more, too!

item.title: Bethany Nowviskie on "What "help" questions are you asked most frequently?"
item.dc:creator: Bethany Nowviskie
item.description:
24. Realistically, what am I getting into in terms of time & cost if I try to [X]?
25. Somebody advised us to use [X] for this project, and we hate it. Is [Y] better? But first know: this is hugely politically fraught.
26. What are all the support options on campus for faculty who want to [X] -- or are not sure if they want to [X].
27. What are the long-term sustainability prospects for my project? Will you preserve it for all time?
